p: All studied borages presented cyme inflorescences: L. erythrorhizon had scorpioid cymes with paired flowers, A. guttata and A. tibetana displayed crowded cymes with many flowers, and A. euchroma exhibited terminal cymes with numerous flowers. The corolla was yellow with or without dark spots on corolla lobes in A. guttata and A. tibetana ( Figures 1A,B), dark purple to purple in A. euchroma ( Figure 1C), and white in L. erythrorhizon ( Figure 1D). The calyx of the three Arnebia species was 5-lobed; whereas that of L. erythrorhizon was 5-parted and more deeply lobed than in Arnebia specimens.
